Name: Issue 334
Introduction: G'day everyone, welcome to issue #334 of Weekly Xamarin - a weekly overview of what happened this past week in the Xamarin and MAUI communities. It's now 2022 and we here at Weekly Xamarin hope everyone has had a refreshing break over the new year period and are now ready to start the new year.  This weeks edition is overflowing with articles published during the New Years  break when everyone was supposed to be on holidays. I'm playing catchup, so sorry about the number of articles. ❤  Kym

Articles.Title: Useful UX Guidelines, Tools And Resources
Articles.Description: A meaningful user experience is what can set your site apart from others. But what makes an experience truly meaningful? And how to achieve that? The tools, tips, and resources in this post not only help you to come up with a UX strategy that works for you and your team but also to circumvent potential UX pitfalls.
Articles.Author: Cosima Mielke

Articles.Title: Converting Xamarin Native templates to .NET 6
Articles.Description: Andreas is impatient and wants the Xamarin Native templates to be updated to the new SDK-Style projects. And here is how.
Articles.Author: Andreas Nesheim

Articles.Title: Using SVG files as App Icons in iOS & Android Xamarin apps
Articles.Description: Using ResizetizerNT to generate all the tedious Xcassets, PNGs & XMLs files, including adaptive and round icons.
Articles.Author: Saamer Mansoor

Articles.Title: Xamarin.Forms and Draggable View
Articles.Description: It’s New Year Tale about how to make Draggable View in Xamarin.Forms Application.
Articles.Author: Bohdan Benetskyi

Articles.Title: Improving the UX when loading data in Xamarin Forms
Articles.Description: Loading data is one of the most common tasks that we do in a mobile application. Make it more enjoyable for your users by using some of these techniques.
Articles.Author: Charlin Agramonte

Articles.Title: Understanding Paths in Data Binding
Articles.Description: This is the first in a series on advanced data binding. This post focuses on understanding how paths are constructed and used in Data Binding.
Articles.Author: Rodrigo Juarez

Articles.Title: Understanding Converters in Databinding
Articles.Description: There are times when you need to bind to a source but the source is not in the right format or otherwise needs to be manipulated. This is where Converters shine.
Articles.Author: Rodrigo Juarez

Articles.Title: Getting Xamarin.Forms Prism navigation service to throw exceptions
Articles.Description: Prism stopped raising exceptions on navigation at some point and now returns a INavigationResult which has a Exception property. Maybe you want to change that, well, this post will show you how.
Articles.Author: Jean-Marie Alfonsi

Articles.Title: Getting started with Font Scaling in .NET MAUI
Articles.Description: Having your application adapt to the font size settings configured in the Operating System makes  for a good user experience. This can be achieved by using Font Scaling. Learn how to use this feature in .NET MAUI.
Articles.Author: Leomaris Reyes

Articles.Title: MAUI Preview 11 is here!
Articles.Description: .NET MAUI Preview 11 continues to stabilize controls and layouts, and introduces multi-window and Fluent updates for Windows.

Articles.Title: Building .NET MAUI apps with GitHub Actions
Articles.Description: Using GitHub Actions to build a cross platform .NET MAUI app for Android, iOS, MacCatalyst and Windows is complicated. Dave explains each step in the process.

Articles.Title: Installing .NET MAUI on macOS
Articles.Description: In this post David covers how you can setup your macOS environment to build .NET MAUI apps even without VS2022.

Articles.Title: The more things change, the more they stay the same
Articles.Description: .NET MAUI has it's roots in Xamarin.Forms and as such, there are parts in Maui that are exactly the same. In this post, Leomaris looks at a few of those things.

Articles.Description: StackLayout is one of the most useful layout types in Xamarin.Forms. In MAUI it has been replaced with a Vertical and a Horizontal StackLayout.

Articles.Description: As you know, .NET MAUI evolved from Xamarin.Forms with a better developer experience and better performance. Like adding a gem to a crown, .NET MAUI allows the use of dependency injection way easier than Xamarin.Forms.
